alert.note: Alert for Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 1:55AM EST until February 18 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North Fork Kentucky River at Hazard. * WHEN...From early this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. The street at the mouth of Big Bottom Branch is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 AM EST Friday the stage was 8.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to around 19.5 feet this evening. It will then fall to around 6.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. The next statement will be issued by 2 PM EST.
